oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The performance of heifers reared in a suckling system
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Vertooren, Judith
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Health and welfare
Feeding and growth
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this study the effects on the performance of heifers reared in a suckling system (suckled heifers) compared to heifers reared in a bucket system (bucket heifers) were investigated. Heifers are young dairy cows that started first lactation. Focus was on the following parameters: age and live weight at first calving, milk production, and mastitis incidence. Also, attention was given to Paratuberculosis since suckling systems might increase the risks on its occurrence.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Vertooren, Judith (2006) The performance of heifers reared in a suckling system. Thesis, Wageningen UR, Biological Farming Systems Group. .
